Parliament.origin: [Anglo-French parlement conference, council, parliament, from parler to speak]

1 a.definition: an assemblage of the nobility, clergy, and commons called together by the British sovereign as the supreme legislative body in the United Kingdom

sub_terms.b: a similar assemblage in another nation or state

2.definition: the supreme legislative body of a usually major political unit that is a continuing institution comprising a series of individual assemblages
